reviews.reviewTitle: HAMILTON NO DAY AT THE BEACH
reviews.reviewText: Extremely disappointed, used this product about 20 times and thought it was great. Then one morning hit the start lever and went about getting ready for work, returned to the kitchen to find that the unit was boiling water like crazy, water all over the counter and dripping down on my hardwood floor, unit almost boiled dry and would have if given a few more minutes. Tried the unit again after letting it dry out completely and the same thing, did not shut off, just kept heating until the water was ready to blow out the top. Contacted Hamilton Beach as I was just outside the return window and they were happy to send me a new unit as long as I paid SHIPPING AND HANDLING $12 BUCKS. I purchased on a lightning deal for $16 Thanks a bunch HAMILTON BEACH. So in the recycle bin and I will never buy a Hamilton beach product again. DON'T BE FOOLED BY THE REVIEWS THIS IS JUNK

reviews.reviewTitle: Another Broken Hamilton Beach Kettle < 1 Year Old | TERRIBLE WARRANTY SUPPORT
reviews.reviewText: Breaks after less than a year of use, could be the safety fuse BUT...the bottom of the kettle is held in place by what can only be China-specific 3-slotted screws. So, I can't replace the fuse (as another user suggested). Hamilton-Beech's recommendation? Send back the kettle and get a replacement...shipping at buyer expense BOTH WAYS. So...shipping would be > cost of new kettle. Guess I'll be getting a new kettle, but Hamilton Beach will never get a cent from me again. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY LIKE I DID - BUY A BRAUN OR OTHER RELIABLE BRAND THAT WILL LAST LONGER THAN 8 MONTHS.

Bought this unit back on November, 2016. Lasted only until March, 2017. Defective switch. Called customer service for a replacement and they said because it was under a limited warranty, I would have to pay for shipping. Shipping cost would be more than half the cost of the product. Not worth it.

ordered on June 23rd. Product failed on September 3rd.

Followed all manufacturer's instructions. Only used it to heat water.

Failure happened in the following fashion: unit did not turn off. wife noticed a smell of burning plastic. Found water all over the counter as if the unit's structural integrity had failed. Due to mfgr's warranty terms (owner pays shipping handling) it's not even worth taking them up on getting a replacement.

Would not recommend.

Since I live in dorms and I am not all the time in the room, I couldn‚Äôt go with something super cheap and neglect the safety aspect, but at the same time my budget is a bit limited since I am still a student.

This water boiler was the perfect solution for me since it took into consideration all my concerns. I very much trust the brand, the price is affordable and it is small and fast!

I bought the refurbished one, which made it even cheaper and I feel better for recycling! I have been using it for over half a year and so far never experienced any problems and have no complaints at all. Definitely recommend to anyone who needs a small fast water boiler!

Update: Sept 7, 2017

I wanted to add that I have been using this now for quite a while and am still super satisfied with it! Nothing ever malfunctioned or broke!

I didn't even know a tea kettle could suck it's like the simplest thing in the world. I have no idea how you can screw this up. I'm pretty mad thing leaked all over the place and popped my breaker. Left it on went to the other room for a few min came back when I heard a pop. There was a huge puddle around the kettle. Then when I picked it up boiling water just went everywhere. Looked under it and it was leaking out like a faucet. I dryer it off a bit and took this photo it's leaking from ever hole depending on which way you tilt it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Leaking after 6 months of daily use.
reviews.reviewText: I am very disappointed with this purchase. I threw this away yesterday because it is now leaking.... This did not even last 6 months of daily use.

reviews.reviewTitle: There are better options out there
reviews.reviewText: I wouldnt buy this. Only because it doesnt get to a hot enough temp to fully steep drinks. Resulting in blander tasting coffee and tea.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like this kettle so much I bought one for me and two to give.
reviews.reviewText: For many years I was boiling water for my tea in the microwave even though there was a kettle available on the stove. Somehow turning the gas stove on for a single cup of tea didn't make much sense to me. My family, however, insisted on using the kettle, as they firmly believed that tea from the microwave was gross. They were right, it wasn't the same but I needed to find a happy medium. Something fast and measured. I liked this little kettle so much that I bought one for me and two to give. It is the perfect utilitarian gift for tea and instant coffee drinkers. It boils fast, looks good on the counter and is well priced. It is also easy to clean. I would say this kettle is the most used gadget in our kitchen... or a close competitor to the microwave. I highly recommend this electric kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for Everyone in Our House
reviews.reviewText:
It's one of those things we didn't think we needed until we bought and now we can't live without because of ease of use. No more worrying about tea boiling over in the microwave or on the stove and much more energy efficient. We use it in our house multiple times a day for tea, oatmeal, or instant ramen. It's nice for single serve as well as large quantities for multiple cups of tea or oatmeal. I timed it for heating one cup comfortably within a minute. It's definitely much faster than trying to boil tea in a kettle for one person or microwaving.

My grandfather also sometimes forgot to turn off the stove after boiling hot water for himself, so this is a significantly safer alternative for him.

I purchased this in November of 2016. No rusting or spots noted like some of the other reviewers, as of yet, but I also drain out any remaining water after boiling as per the instructions.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mine has leaked from the bottom since the day I bought it. I hate this thing.
reviews.reviewText: I fill the water to the fill line put it on the base plug it in and flip the switch. It does boil water quickly and efficiently but not so much safely. as soon as the water starts to boil the liquid starts to come out of the bottom and run all over my counter and down to the floor. I have stopped using it since as I was afraid that it would cause a short since its not suppose to do that. Mine was a real safety hazard and I didn't keep the box so I didn't feel I could return it. I advise you to spend your money elsewhere and get a different model or brand all together as this one sucks.

reviews.reviewTitle: Rusting in less than six months
reviews.reviewText: A patch of rust has appeared in the interior of the kettle, where the base meets the wall. Surely that's not supposed to happen. But it did. To the recycling bin.

reviews.reviewTitle: I am disappointed in this very much
reviews.reviewText: I read that the only plastic was the underside of the lid which I could live with. When it arrived the mesh filter was plastic and I removed that. Most upsetting was the plastic along the side to indicate the water level. That can not be removed and it touches all the water I boil. I am disappointed in this very much.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cheaply made but gets the job done
reviews.reviewText:
I had a great electric kettle that I gave to my son for his dorm room. Since it was a brand X product that I rescued from a close-out bin, I figured I had nowhere to go but up. Imagine my surprise when I went to place this Hamilton Beach pot on its heating base AND IT WOBBLED. I must have spent 10 minutes trying to get a solid seat, orienting it this way and that, getting my magnifiers to look for a hidden tab or slot that might enable it to dock securely. Finally, I realized that it is just another cheaply made product churned out by the thousands by underpaid workers in some sweatshop in China. Since I have it on my kitchen counter in an area that is relatively free from activity and clutter, I can live with it, but if you are buying this for a more crowded space where it might get bumped, this is something to consider. And maybe I got the one that slipped through quality control, and YMMV.

Anyway, what I like about it is that it is one liter (not a lot of choice in this size) and boils water quite quickly. It might be a bit difficult to clean the inside if you have large hands: the lid pops up 90 degrees, but the opening is still a bit small. Oh, and the lid gets hot when the water boils, so if you reuse it right away you might need a hot pad to close it. Lastly, it was not shipped in a box. A mailing label was simply slapped right on the product box which, since it wasn‚Äôt made to withstand the rigors of the USPS, arrived crushed on one side. Fortunately this didn‚Äôt affect the product that I could see.

It does the job. So 5 starts for that.

But it feels cheap, like a toy kettle. It‚Äôs very light weight which should be a good thing but it‚Äôs so light that it wobbles on the heating stand. This makes me a little nervous. This is my first Hamilton Beach product. I‚Äôm not impressed. It definitely doesn‚Äôt feel like $20+ quality, more like $10. I‚Äôm regretting that I didn‚Äôt spend extra money but oh well. I could‚Äôve returned but I needed it since my Aroma kettle died after 5 years of good usage.

There are some misleading negative reviews on this boiler. I think there are some people putting too much water in the carafe before they boil, and thus they are getting overflow and foam and such. Fill it to the line where it says lol. The water boils SO FAST!!!! It's the perfect amount to make two 16 oz cups of tea, or coffee. I use this for making tea and for my AeroPress. It's totally awesome, I haven't had any issues yet.

The one downside is the length of the plug/cord. It's super small and very short. I had to get an extension for this to work in my office. But that was no big deal. I love it!

after 2 weeks of using the rust showed up .. :/ I bought this kettle because my 2 year old also Hamilton Beach had some rust on it. 2 years I understand but 2 weeks?? I am very unhappy with this purchase, I just wasted my money .

This works great until the switch that turns it on breaks. This morning, I tried to turn it on, and the clear, illuminated switch at the base of the handle, that turns it on to start heating, was broken.

I took it apart and it is hard to believe that this company would make the switch so weak. This switch has two arms in the base that extend into the base to work as a lever to make the switch connection. where these two arms extend into the handle to the illuminated switch, those arms connect to the illuminated switch on both sides with only a 1/16" thick clear plastic that simply breaks after a period of time. No way to avoid this breaking. I think the temperature that this clear plastic sees from the bottom heating element degrades the plastic over time so that it has to fail.

Built in obsolescence so that you have to buy another one.

Amazing that the rest of the pot seems to be very heavy duty, and heats great. For this poor switch design to be included seems just out of place.

reviews.reviewTitle: Probably beats most 2-3 times the price
reviews.reviewText: 3 weeks in, I can't speak to longevity, but it's holding up well to frequent daily use. The bottom interior did spot a bit as seen in other people's images, but nothing concerning. The main downsides are the overly complex, insufficiently robust plastic mechanisms in the lid, and the unnecessary fill level window. Both of these areas are opportunities for failure and/or cleaning issues, where simpler design would have been better. As someone with decent spatial reasoning, I know how much liquid is in the pot. The only pots I've seen on Amazon that didn't have those issues were much more expensive and have worse issues. It gets the job done, pretty quickly, and without too much noise.

reviews.reviewTitle: Oh my goodness! I LOVE THIS!
reviews.reviewText: I was worried that going to a 1 liter pot from my old 1.7 liter pot would be a problem, but the new one is actually easier to lift and carry and quicker to heat to boiling. It really does heat to a boil faster than in a microwave - and it's probably safer, too, as some believe microwaves change the chemistry of your food and beverages. It's a most beautifully designed pot, too, when compared to the other electric kettles for the price. Many reviews suggest heating only water in it, but with the flat stainless steel surface and no heating elements exposed inside, I don't know why you couldn't heat other things, too. Definitely send it to college with your favorite student, or buy it for Mother's Day, especially if she's a senior citizen. It's so practical! No fear of burning the house down because it shuts itself off once the contents reach a boil. It's cheaper than a bouquet of flowers and will last so much longer. This is my favorite purchase in a long time!

I bought this electric kettle in June of 2016. When it was working, I loved it. Heated water up quickly and had a automatic shut feature so I could walk away. After about 7 1/2 months of use, the button no longer stays down so I can't heat up any water. I saw someone else who bought it around the same time I did left a similar review of the same problem. I just contacted the manufacture since it's been less than a year. We'll see if they are able to repair/replace/refund since it's still under warranty.

reviews.reviewTitle: 6 months in, the kettle is rusting
reviews.reviewText: Kettle works well, and had I written a review after receiving it, I probably would have left a favorable review. However, after 6 months, the rim of the kettle is rusting out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Strong Smell of Burning Plastic - Buyers Beware
reviews.reviewText:
I've only used this kettle twice, and I already need to throw it out. It gives off a very strong chemical/burning plastic smell when boiling water, so much so that I would not risk drinking from it for fear of contaminants. I'm using filtered water that boils fine when using other pots, so I know the smell is coming from the kettle.

On closer look, I noticed that several of the internal parts seems to be made of plastic. I bought this kettle because the material listed on the description says "Stainless Steel", and would never have made the purchase if I'd known my water would be boiling with plastic! Very disappointed in the purchase, wish I'd kept the box so I can return it.

I absolutely love this kettle. A little smaller than the one it replaced but that is OK because it does the job. I actually take this kettle with me when I travel out of the country to boil and purify my water. It fits great in my carry-on. Holds 8 ounces of water and heats up in 90 to 120 seconds. Easy to clean and lightweight. One advantage over my old kettle that I like is the lid will actually stay open if you want to. Overall very pleased and definitely would buy this product again and highly recommend it to others.

Electric kettles are listed here from $17.99 to several hundred dollars! This one, at $17.99, is at the lowest price point. It works perfectly. It looks good. Except if you need one with a higher capacity than 1L - there are models that hold 1.5-2Ls - I can see no reason to pay a penny more. They all boil water, nothing more. They do not polish your silver or iron your shirts. Not highly scientific at all. I've been using the one I bought for a month, at least twice a day. I will post again if it fails but unless that happens it is a very useful product and a great value.

Love it! Looks great in our kitchen, number one. Two, it heats the water fast. Three, it's stainless, not plastic, that touches your water. Four, it comes off a stationary base to serve and it removes easily. Five, it's just the right size for one or two people -- I don't need bigger than 1 liter, ever! Six, the top puts up with a spring release which is pretty cool. And seven -- well, hoping it lasts forever, but that may be pushing it since I got this for like $16. as an Amazon Deals item which had clearly never been opened, just a crinkled box. Oh, and the switch lights up when heating until it flips off at boiling. In sum, it's a keeper.

I love this little electric kettle. I use it to heat water in my bathroom, for face washing, instead of letting the water run from the tap until it gets hot. It heats up very quickly - I start it before I make the bed and it is done by the time I am finished. The unit is smaller than some so it doesn't take up a lot of counter space. (The water gets to boiling temp, so I mix it in a bowl with some cold water to get just the right degree of hot water.). A great little kettle whenever you need a few cups of very hot water in just a couple minutes.

reviews.reviewTitle: and it is the perfect size to work with my French press
reviews.reviewText: It works faster than the kettle it is replacing, and it is the perfect size to work with my French press. But it leaks when it is filled even a touch higher than max fill, and lately, it leaks around the seams when I'm pouring the water, regardless of how full it was. Also, it doesn't always click off after it starts to boil anymore. I was out of the room and it boiled half the kettle off by the time I noticed. But it does the job and I'm still using it a year later.

reviews.reviewTitle: The box was pretty banged up
reviews.reviewText:
I've been spoiled by jet boil and want hot beverages at my desk, so I went in search of a cheap electric kettle. It arrived today and I've used it exactly once to make sure it was in working order. The box was pretty banged up, but the kettle was just fine. Rinsed it out, filled it with filtered water and heated it up. Boiled and shut off in about 4 minutes. I only have two minor complaints, but for the price they aren't a huge deal.

First of all the cord is extremely short, I will have to invest in an appropriate extension cord in order to use it where I want.

Second, I did not realize when I bought this that it is single wall stainless. The kettle is not insulated. It gets pretty hot when there is boiling water in it. I missed when I went to pick it up and almost burned myself. An insulated cozy or a sleeve would easily fix this, but upon cursory glance at the web I didn't see anything that would fit.

All in all, it seems to be fine. With the winter weather starting here, it will be nice to have tea at work!

I bought a hamilton beach kettle from retail, and it did not work after several months. Then I bought a new one on the amazon days ago, and this time, it just cannot shut off automatically.And it will boil the water to dry if I let it be. I am done with the hamilton beach! It's my fault to buy it again! It's totally a waste of time!And I'll never to be silly to buy any of its product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great size, quiet really like it!
reviews.reviewText: This is my 2nd Hamilton Beach hot water pot. I really like the smaller size. My old one began to stop shutting off after boiling but that‚Äôs after 10+ years. This new pot not only shuts off but emits 1/10th the steam out the pour spout which I really like and it‚Äôs very quiet. Wish I had purchased it sooner.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great for instant noodle soups
reviews.reviewText: Boils water faster than the stove, and I use this for more than just making tea. I use a percolator on the stove top to make coffee, so instead of waiting for the water to boil, I'll speed up the process with the kettle. Works great for instant noodle soups, I also use it to heat water up for my carpet cleaner. I've used it many times and it works flawlessly, I like how it comes off the base so I don't have a cord hanging off the pitcher when trying to pour boiling hot water. And I like how it shuts itself off so I don't have to worry about boiling hot water overflowing on the stove.

reviews.reviewTitle: This works exactly as advertised, but it's pretty easy to scald your fingers on it
reviews.reviewText:
Pros: The cordless serve feature is pretty great. Water heats up fast, and heats to a roiling boil.

Cons: The stainless steel body conducts heat VERY well, and since the water gets up to boiling, it gets hot enough to burn your fingers. Added to that, the styling LOOKS like there's some sort of insulating layer to keep the water hot and the surface cool. This is not the case. I'm a grown adult and *probably* should have figured this out prior to burning the backs of my index and middle fingers on the metal surface, so some of this comes to user error, but I would be very hesitant to bring this into a household with children.

reviews.reviewTitle: So worth the money--you will love it!
reviews.reviewText:
So far, this device has been fantastic! As stated above, it heats up water faster than you can in a microwave. It is also significantly more convenient than a microwave in that, you can keep it at your desk, and have practically instant hot water for tea, hot chocolate, or, for everyone's favorite snack--RAMEN!
The big advantage is that it is CORDLESS! That's right, you can pick it up and take it to where you need it to be! So very cool, and convenient as all get out!
I would absolutely recommend this to a friend, and I would absolutely purchase again if needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this middle power packed kettle
reviews.reviewText: Love this middle power packed kettle. Literally brings water to a boil in 2mins (if that long). Also love the self shut off. I took away a star because it need some kind of whistling mechanism to alert you that the water is ready. Though I'm guessing why there isn't one is because by the time you turn around and make the first step to leave your kitchen is water has come to a scalding boil. ü§∑üèΩ

reviews.reviewTitle: I am so glad I bought this
reviews.reviewText: This was a "want," not a "need," but I am so glad I bought this. Clearly anyone can boil some water on the stove with a kettle or pot. But I was getting stressed out by my time crunch in the mornings, and this is just so convenient. I was aware from the reviews that some people's electric kettles had leaked, but as I have granite countertops and tile in my kitchen, I didn't think it was much of a risk just to give this a try. I have been using it for about 9 months and it still works as well as it did on day one.

I bought it for my desk/office at work. Good size (not too big, not too small). I'd say good for 1-2 people. Would be small for 3+
Good quality. Works well. Good value. Would recommend. Would make a nice gift for a tea lover. My only negative comment is the cord is quite short. Maybe 2 feet long, if that. You can make it shorter by wrapping it in base a bit (for counter use), but it wasn't long enough for my office so I used an extension cord and it's fine.

This was a gift for my sister and I noticed the other day that she was heating up water for tea and it was making a very loud whistling noise, she said it had been doing this for about two weeks now, and she has only been using this for a little over a month. Kind of disappointing for such a popular brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Flawless So Far -- and Cool to the Touch
reviews.reviewText:
I expected this to boil water fast, and not to leak. I expected it to shut off automatically when the water boils. I expected it to be simple and basic. It meets all these expectations easily.

What I didn't expect was that it would boil a liter of water and still be completely cool to the touch, so I could pick it up and pour without needing an oven mitt (my hands are very sensitive to heat; I always need insulation with stove-top kettles).

So yeah, it's perfect so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great. Boils water very quickly and the water is ...
reviews.reviewText: Works great. Boils water very quickly and the water is a lot hotter than when I used a kettle on the stove. Only reason I gave it 4 stars is because it draws a lot of power quickly and it blew a fuse in my house when it was running at the same time as another high draw appliance. Not the company's fault there but I just wanted others to know if they have an older home this is still a good kettle just watch if you use it at the same time as other appliances.

reviews.reviewTitle: Recommending for quickly heating water for beverages
reviews.reviewText: This pot is very easy to use. We use filtered water. The viewing panel makes it easy to see how much water is in the pot without opening the lid. After heating, the water in the pot stays hot for quite awhile. Dispensing of the hot water into a mug or cup is smooth and you don't need to push a button. It rinses and wipes clean. There is an auto-off feature so the water can't boil away if you walk away from it. We have used it daily for more than a month and there is no rust.

Use it mostly every day. This is compact. I had another Hamilton which was wider and had more water capacity but for one person was too much. This one, has a lot of water capacity too and is not as heavy as the other when lifting. It shuts off automatically and heats the water just right and pretty fast. No issues of mold or anything for me. And you just need to follow the instructions provided on how to clean and your set. Can't wait for winter to arrive and go crazy with this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the convenience Plan to return but get another brand
reviews.reviewText:
Starting to rust inside base so not sure I should continue to use it.
Love the convenience
Plan to return but get another brand.
1 month later
I am still trying to resolve this problem. Amazon won't help just referred me to Hamilton beach .I'm going to their site now to see what an be done.

Switch stopped working in less than a week. Though it's under warranty, the policy is that we'd need to pay $11.49 for shipping the $18.89 kettle. Chose not to go through this hassle. Just feel really wasteful for the steel, it's pretty good material, but unfortunately the final product has bad quality.

Very disappointing... I was looking forward to enjoy hot water for my tea, but the kettle leaks. At first I thought maybe it was because I filled and some water may have spatter but as it heats up, I see puddles on the platter and I am very afraid of an electrical hazard. I am returning and will try the Amazon one.

Used the unit 4 or 5 times and it broke the day after my return period expired. I have had an electric kettle for 7 or 8 years. It is great. (It was NOT made by Hamilton Beach) Wanted another smaller one for a different room to be used only once in a while. Mistake at trying to save money. HAMILTON BEACH IS NOW ON MY DON'T BUY LIST.
Love this little kettle. My husband and I drink a lot of tea and this is so perfect to use for a single cup or a small pot. Heats very quickly and shuts off automatically when done.

reviews.reviewTitle: Medium-sized kettle that will last a long time
reviews.reviewText:
My parents and I drink probably 2 liters of tea among us a day, every day, and this kettle has lasted over two years with this daily usage (in addition to cooking uses). This kettle isn't gorgeous or anything, but it lasts forever and its volume is reasonable. For tea and cooking single servings of pasta, etc. it's very adequate. The previous kettle we had was this gorgeous glass thing that cost around $60 and it broke after two months; this one's $20 and still going strong.

If the calcium buildup from tap water bothers you, you can clean it pretty easily; the opening is big enough to fit a hand and sponge in. The cord is pretty short. I bought one of these to bring to college and I'm betting I'll be using it until I graduate.

We did not need a full sized kettle for heating up water, since I am the only one that drinks coffee in the house in the morning. This arrived on time and is a little smaller than I am used to seeing around. It only holds about a liter, but I only fill it up with about two cups for coffee in the morning and it is much faster than putting a tea kettle of the gas stove. I love this, because it takes less than 2 minutes to heat to full temp and it looks good on the counter as well. Very pleased.

reviews.reviewTitle: Switch doesn‚Äôt want to stay down
reviews.reviewText: Have made tea twice with this. Heat 1-liter, 3 times, to make a 3-liter pitch of tea for the week. The very first liter out of the box was flawless, but each of the 5 liters afterwards have been frustrating, because the switch doesn‚Äôt want to stay down. I suspect this is due to the less-than-snug connection with the base. I read about this in another review. I also dinged this on ease-of-cleaning, since you,d have to have a 6-year old‚Äôs hand to fit inside. I might hunt down those bogus answers in the Q&A. Hope it lasts, but at $17, I won‚Äôt despair if it dies .. it just means I‚Äôll have to invest more time looking for a hardier replacement.

reviews.reviewTitle: It was reported as one of the best and I appreciate the ease and speed of using it.
reviews.reviewText:
I have wanted to get one of these types of heating pots for many years as they work so quickly. I just never seemed to think about it. This one came highly recommended by one of the Consumer Reports magazines. So I ordered it up and have been happy about it. I like Stainless Steel as it resists staining and is very durable.
Part Two
I have been working on a little house and thought, "Why not get another pot. That way I can be uninterrupted from my labor". So I did. Since there is no sink or other water source inside I have to fill it from the tap outside. It is the same great tool that the one at home is. You click it on and it clicks itself off. Great!
Has to be used several time before It is really ready because of the slight plastic smell and taste.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well, but incredibly difficult to clean...
reviews.reviewText:
The size and price point of this electric kettle is awesome! It also works well; heats up water in about a minute. BUT...the design of this product is kind of a fail:

- The flip-top lid (as with a lot of electric kettles) isn't removable so cleaning the lid (which is made of plastic, another meh) is difficult. The lid is also attached from the inside, which then blocks part of the opening into the kettle when you're trying to clean it, making it awkward to get to all these nooks and crannies that you can't even reach with a toothbrush.
- I also don't like that the interior portion of the lid is made of plastic. Steam is hotter than boiling water so inadvertently, as the water boils, the plastic inside can melt/degrade INTO your water. I don't even know if it's BPA-free plastic!
- There's this thin, metal "rod" looking thing inside that runs along the entire height of the kettle. Perhaps it's part of the heating unit or encases wires, but it's located near the wall of the kettle, without touching the wall. It creates a narrow space between the kettle and this rod that is, again, difficult to clean.

Maybe I'm being too much of a clean/health freak but you have to give these things a good washing every so often and with the way the product is designed, I couldn't even give it a good initial wash before use.

reviews.reviewTitle: This stainless one seemed like a good fit
reviews.reviewText:
This is a fabulous product! I gave my older hot pot to my boys when they left for college, because I was excited to try something nicer/newer. This stainless one seemed like a good fit, because of its size and a few other features. So far, I love how fast it heats and how long it stays hot, but I wish it had more options as far as the amount of water I can heat.
PROS
--Smaller design is perfect for my use. 1 liter (about a quart) maximum gets me a couple large cups of coffee out of my french press, or several smaller cups of herb tea for me and my girls.
--Stays very hot FOREVER! I love that the water heats, then stays steaming hot for hours.
--The top stays open automatically. When I dump the hot water, I can set the hotpot on the counter with the lid open and let it dry naturally.
--There is no heating element inside, unlike with my older hot pot. This means I can make oatmeal, ramen, easy mac, or herb tea right in the pot, without having to transfer to another container. Then I can serve into different dishes or mugs.
-- Easy to clean because there is no heating element in the inside of the pot.

CONS
--The minimum amount is about 20 ounces, which is more than I'd like to do sometimes. I wish I could heat just 8 or 10 ounces, which would be super quick if I just want a cup of hot tea in the middle of the night.
--The difference between the minimum (.6 liters) and the maximum (1 liter) is pretty minor. I find myself filling, then realizing I haven't filled enough, then overfilling and having to throw some out. Silly, but annoying.

Overall, GREAT product for the price!!! I would buy it again, and will probably get one for my college kids so they can make ramen and oatmeal more easily.

This is actually bigger than I expected but it's not huge. Looks nice on my countertop. It boils water really fast and the automatic shutoff is great. The water-level gauge/window is directly underneath the handle so you can't actually see it while you're filling the kettle up, which is stupid (sorry--it really is). And water gets trapped under there and the little window never dries out. I'm trying to ignore that but it's a little gross. It does get hot to the touch while it's on but not burn-your-hand hot. I like it and the price is definitely right but I wish it was just a little better thought out.

Pros:
1. It's not too loud- it quiets down after the first minute of heating if it's not full.
2. It cleans up nicely with a quick wipe with a damp cloth. I probably should wash the inside more often but that's no problem to clean either.
3.The little filter screen is still in good shape and if it get's lost there is still a metal strainer that is always there.
4. The automatic shut off is timed well, I think. It comes to a full boil for no more than 5 seconds before it shuts off. And if you take it off the base it automatically flips the switch so when you put it back on it doesn't keep heating.
5. It's a good size - not so big that you have to boil way more water than you would use for one cup of tea. But big enough for 5 small mugs (like the one pictured) or 4 bigger ones.

Compare all of that to our last kettle of a different brand that broke. It was too loud, the screen fell apart (dissolved in the water?? I don't know, one day it just wasn't there but the frame was) and that made the automatic shut-off iffy. It would boil for 10-20 seconds before it shut off. Made me wonder if it might someday not shut off automatically. Not so with this one.

We use it to heat water for cooking (it's faster than our stove!), to fill the hot water bottle in the winter, to clean our drains, and of course for making tea!

I do recommend this product! especially if you like to make 1-5 cups of tea at a time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Search is Finally Over....NO PLASTIC, 5 yr warranty in Canada

(But they are the most gorgeous kettles!) Today I happened to be walking through the Hudson's Bay and saw this kettle. I've never been particularly impressed by Hamilton Beach, but my eye happened to see an attached sticker that said "FIVE YEAR WARRANTY - Longest Warranty Available." This is rare; everything these days is designed for obsolescence - our landfills are choking on shoddy crap and it should be illegal. Anyway, it looked cute and simple and exactly the right size for me; I'm the only tea drinker in the house so I don't require a giant kettle. One litre is plenty. I looked inside and it was all stainless steel except for a plastic filter that is easily removed. I also noticed that it doesn't have a gap between the walls of the kettle and the bottom; this is where crud and rust usually occur. I brought it home and fired it up. Normally I boil water on my gas stove and it takes so long I can practically have a nap. This kettle had my water at a roaring boil in under two minutes. And it continued to boil for a few more seconds before gasping out a big plume of steam. I like my tea piping hot, so this is important. I paid $32 Canadian for this kettle and I'm quite shocked, to be honest. Here's the weird thing...the manual reads that if the kettle was purchased in Canada, you get a 5 year warranty. Purchased in the US, the warranty is one year. This is baffling; rarely is it an advantage to be a Canadian shopper - usually we're choked that everything costs us twice as much. reviews.reviewTitle: Great small kettle for the price.
reviews.reviewText:
Works exactly as I hoped it would. It is made to ONLY heat water. The complaints about being able to wash it out are somewhat unwarranted. If you only boil water (not tea, not soup) the only thing that will accumulate over time is scale which you can boil out with some cream of tartar. Nothing biological can survive the boiling water and steam it will be exposed to.

In my experience, It will boil 1 liter of water from room temperature in about 4.5 minutes. I like the fact that it doesn't have a cord attached when I lift the kettle more than I thought I would. The water does come into direct contact some plastic, the scale filter in the spout which you can remove and the water level gauge which you cannot remove. The underside of the lid is made of plastic and steam will accumulate/condense on it then fall back into the water, but it appears to be high temperature plastic. I am not worried about leaching with this limited exposure.

When you use this kettle, don't leave water in it to cool down. Only heat what you need each time and pour any excess out while it is still hot to help reduce scale buildup.

reviews.reviewTitle: I got a leaker but it does heat the water boiling hot

Otherwise, this is a nice little hot water kettle for the price although it is not pleasant to use. I don't expect music or aromatherapy or Bluetooth connectivity when I'm heating water, but there are things that could be improved by this simple kettle. First, the opening is rather small, so getting water in and seeing the water level is hard to do at the same time. Yes, there is a plastic level monitor on the side, but unless the light level in the room is bright you cannot see the water level. Consequently, it is easy to overfill this (of course it is very easy to pour out the overage through the well-designed spout, which is the only good feature of the product). I'm not a fan of the on-off switch being below the handle or the plastic/stainless steel lid. Also, I would advise not actually touching the stainless steel sides after the water is hot (that might be common sense, but I've had electric kettles in the past that do not get hot on the exterior, go figure).

The unit is quite noisy once the water starts boiling, and I suspect that is due to the smaller size of the product and thin stainless steel. I will say the handle is very comfortable, but someone with larger hands might have problems with comfort. All that said, however, the water comes out boiling hot, which is really all we want for an electric kettle.

The bottom line is, if you need a cheap hot water kettle that provides up to 1 liter of boiling water, then this might fit the bill, but hopefully, you don't get a leaker or a gusher.
